title: Think layoffs are bad now? Executives warn millions of jobs could be axed in 2026
description: Many companies may cut jobs in 2026 as they use more artificial intelligence. A new survey shows big firms are planning layoffs, especially in marketing roles. Unemployment is already high, and hiring is slowing. Some CEOs warn workers to learn AI skills, while others say AI will mostly change tasks, not replace jobs.
content:

title: Nvidia strikes a deal with Groq, an AI chip startup
description: Nvidia, the maker of artificial intelligence chips and the world’s most valuable public company, agreed to license the technology of chip startup Groq and hire its top executives.
content:
Nvidia, the maker of artificial intelligence chips and the world’s most valuable public company, agreed to license the technology of chip startup Groq and hire its top executives.

title: Nvidia reaches technology licensing deal with startup Groq
description: Nvidia Corp. agreed to a licensing deal with artificial intelligence startup Groq, furthering its investments in companies connected to the AI boom and gaining the right to add a new type of technology to its products.
content:

title: Starbucks CEO says AI is 'co-pilot,' not replacement for workers
description: Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol said that artificial intelligence serves as a support tool for baristas rather than using it to replace them.
